summary: This is a forensic examination report from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) Cyber Investigations Office. It details a manual review of three BOP-issued Samsung Galaxy S9 phones belonging to correctional officers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The review was conducted to determine if the devices contained any unauthorized communications related to the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The examination found only one relevant message, which was an appropriate reiteration of staff instructions not to comment on the matter.

keyFacts: The OIG conducted a forensic review of three BOP-issued Samsung phones belonging to correctional officers at the MCC to check for unauthorized communications about Epstein's suicide.
The review was manual to avoid disrupting the phones' service; forensic tools would have required wiping the devices.
Only one message across all three devices was found to relate to Epstein. It was an appropriate reminder to staff not to comment on the ongoing matter.
The report states there were no allegations of misconduct against the BOP employees to whom the phones were issued.
The forensic examination found no evidence of inappropriate or unauthorized communication related to Epstein's death on the reviewed devices.
